description: In binary: write what is described (putting a leading zero on numbers which have an odd number of binary digits).
example: a(54)=2 because 54 = 110110 base 2, which can be read as one 1 followed by zero 1's followed by one 0, i.e. 10 base 2 = 2 base 10
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 20 2000
